sect1.title: The Flashlight perspective
sect1.para: The Flashlight perspective organizes the Eclipse workbench to show views which will help you to interact with data from program runs.

This perspective is useful for beginning use of the Flashlight tool. Its "canned" organization can help you to understand the capabilities of the tool. Advanced users may want to reconfigure the screen layout and save a custom perspective.

sect2.title: Views
sect2.para: This section describes the various Flashlight views unique to the Flaslight Eclipse client, and that populate the perspective

sect3.title: Flashlight Runs
sect3.para:
The Flashlight Runs view lists information about all of the completed runs of programs launched from the Flashlight launch tab.
Raw
The size of the data produced by the program run.
Prep
The size of the data produced by prepping the run. If the data has not been prepared yet, this column will be blank.
Run
The name of the program run. This is the same name that you see when launching a program from the Flashlight launch tab.
Time
The time the program was launched.
By
The user the program ran under.
Java
The version of the JVM that ran the program.
Vendor
The JVM vendor.
OS
The operating system the program ran under.
Max Memory (MB)
The maximum amount of memory in megabtyes allotted to the program.
Processors
The number of CPU's that the JVM ran on when this program was executed.

sect3.title: Query Menu
sect3.para: The Query Menu view displays the queries that can be run from the current query results displayed in the Query Results view. If no results are displayed, then it displays the queries that can be run from the currently selected run in the Flashlight Runs view. Queries that can be run by double-clicking are black, queries that need you to select a more specific row from the Query Results view are grayed out.

sect3.title: Query Results
sect3.para: This view displays the results from performing a query on a Flashlight run. You can change the results displayed by clicking on a different query in the Query Results Explorer view or in the Query Menu view.
The result of a query is displayed as either a tree, table, or tree-table, depending on the specific query. describes the different queries and the shapes of their results.

sect3.title: Query Results Explorer
sect3.para: This view allows you to select any of the queries run previously during the session and display it in the Query Results view. You can also delete any or all of the results from here.

sect3.title: Historical Source Snapshot
sect3.para: When a Flashlight run is performed, a snapshot of the project source code is collected. This view shows the source code as it appeared when the run was actually performed.
